question: 欠伸
sourceMnemonic: When you <kanji>lack</kanji> <kanji>stretch</kanji>ing, your body has to get that energy out somehow, so you end up <vocabulary>yawning</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
The reading for this is an exception. Here's a mnemonic to help you:

You've never seen more <vocabulary>yawning</vocabulary> than when you performed <reading>acu</reading>puncture (<ja>あく</ja>) on a <reading>bee</reading> (<ja>び</ja>). It was so relaxed from being the one poked for once that it just couldn't stop yawning.
